business.headline: Ventive Hospitality IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingRetail investors must apply for a minimum of 23 shares per lot, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,789 for retail applicants.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.

DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: The allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.
IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.

NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.
From the world's richest to fifth: The ups and downs of Bernard Arnault Once the world's richest, Bernard Arnault lost $32 billion in 2024 but remains a luxury titan with LVMH's 75 iconic brands.

Salted, pre-packed or caramelised? Popcorn gets stuck in GST mazeThe GST Council's decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check latest GMP, share price, allotment date Mamata Machinery IPO: The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 230 and Rs 243 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot size of 61 shares, which requires a retail investment of Rs 14,823.

PM-JAY for senior citizens: How to register for free health insuranceAyushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana ensures senior citizens over 70 get free health insurance of Rs 5 lakh annually, with a simple enrolment process to make healthcare more accessible.

F&O gamble: 5 reasons why options trading is a losing game for retail tradersOne of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges.
GSTR-9 simplified: Filing, features, deadlines and other details GSTR-9 consolidates GST data for taxpayers exceeding Rs 2 crore turnover, ensuring accurate reconciliation and compliance.
Explained: Why India Cements share price surged 11% today Shares of India Cements rose after UltraTech Cement received a crucial approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI).
Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024: What is it and how to avail it?Settle tax disputes easily under the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by paying the disputed tax and avoiding penalties.

Sensex jumps 800 points: 3 factors behind today's stock market rallyStock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60.

Concord Enviro IPO closes for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMP The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore.

Stocks to watch today: Zomato, RIL, TCS, Vedanta, NTPC Green, Ultratech CementBoth the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 witnessed massive losses last week, with the Sensex dropping over 4,000 points across five consecutive sessions and the Nifty falling by nearly 1,200 points, marking a 5% weekly loss.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Flawed selection process: Congress on appointment of human rights panel chiefCongress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge said the selection process of the NHRC chief was "flawed" and showed the "dismissive approach of the government".

RG Kar rape case: No evidence of struggle at crime scene, says forensic reportThe body of the trainee doctor was found inside the seminar hall of RG Kar hospital on August 9, triggering widespread outrage. The CBI has filed a charge-sheet against prime accused Sanjay Roy.

Will behead their leaders: Israel confirms it killed Hamas leader Haniyeh in IranIsraeli Defence Minister Israel Katz said his country would damage the strategic infrastructure of the Houthis and would "behead their leaders just as we did to Ismail Haniyeh, Yahya Sinwar and Hassan Nasrallah in Tehran".

Rohit backs 'modern-day great' Virat, tight-lipped about his batting spotAustralia vs India, 4th Test: India captain Rohit Sharma expressed confidence in Virat Kohli overcoming his struggles outside the off-stump. However, the skipper refrained from revealing his batting position for the Boxing Day Test, adding to the speculation.

Diet Coke with protein shake? The new viral drink is not what experts recommendProtein Diet Coke is a blend of Diet Coke and a flavoured protein shake (mostly vanilla) that Rebecca Gordan, a teacher from Utah, introduced.

Congress leader's complaint against Allu Arjun over urination scene in Pushpa 2A Congress leader in Telangana has filed a complaint against Allu Arjun and the "Pushpa 2" team over a controversial scene in the film, which shows the actor urinating in a swimming pool.

Dalit boy invited to birthday, stripped, urinated upon in UP; dies by suicideThe victim's family alleged that the boy was invited to a birthday party where he was brutally assaulted, stripped and urinated upon by four people who even filmed the heinous act.

Maharashtra man gives triple talaq to wife for refusing to sleep with his bossAfter the wife refused to sleep with her husband's boss, the accused physically assaulted her, gave her instant talaq and threw her out of the house in Maharashtra's Kalyan.

What has forced Pakistan govt to discuss Imran Khan's release?The Pakistani government is in talks with the party of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan. Internal pressure and growing calls for Khan's release globally by influential people have made the government discuss Khan's release, among other issues with PTI.

Australian teenager Sam Konstas to debut in Boxing Day Test vs IndiaAustralia vs India: Sam Konstas is set to make his debut in the Boxing Day Test against India, with Australia coach Andrew McDonald confirming his selection.

Drug smuggler killed in California shootout, Goldy Brar gang claims responsibilitySunil Yadav, a drug smuggler, who was associated with the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, was killed in California's Stockton. He had used a fake passport to flee India to Dubai and then the US two years ago.

Video: UP men scream, beg to stop as truck drags them for 500 metresA truck driver dragged two people for about 500 metres in Agra under his vehicle. Some locals forced the driver to stop the truck and extricated the men from under the vehicle. Police arrested the driver and seized the truck.

Odyssey: Christopher Nolan's next with Tom-Zendaya, adapted from Homer's epicChristopher Nolan is set to direct a new film titled The Odyssey, featuring a stellar cast including Matt Damon, Tom Holland, and Zendaya. The film is an adaptation of Homer's epic poem.

Eat popcorn and sleep: Shashi Tharoor on GST council's tax formula for snackCongress MP Shashi Tharoor mocked the GST Council's decision to impose varied popcorn tax slabs, sparking criticism of the system's complexity. Congress leaders called the move absurd, highlighting widespread GST evasion, tax fraud, and loopholes in compliance processes.

Shyam Benegal: Pioneer of parallel cinema, creator of 'Bharat Ek Khoj'Indian cinema mourns the loss of Shyam Benegal, a pioneer of parallel cinema, who died at 90. Known for socially reflective films like Ankur and Manthan, his legacy spans six decades of storytelling.

Ex-Trump attorney general pick paid thousands for drugs, sex with minor: ReportThe House Ethics Committee accused ex-Representative Matt Gaetz of paying for sex, violating Florida's statutory rape law, and using illicit drugs.

Why number of women in Indian workforce stagnates despite inclusive initiativesTheir 18 per cent representation in the workforce in FY2024 is marginally lower than the previous year and no different from FY2021 when it was just 19 per cent

Vinod Kambli has clots in brain, reveals doctor after medical examinationsFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli has been hospitalised in Thane after his health deteriorated and the medical examinations have revealed that the cricketer has clots in his brain.

Farmer garlands minister with onions on stage in protest over price dropFarmers in Maharashtra protest plummeting onion prices by placing a garland of onions on Minister Nitesh Rane. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar urged the Centre to remove the 20 per cent export duty, citing farmer distress and climate challenges amid surplus crops.

Kolkata's viral 'Russian Chaiwali' forced to shut store after moral policingViral Kolkata entrepreneur Papia Ghosal, known as the 'Russian Chaiwali,' was forced to shut her tea shop in Andul due to alleged moral policing and gender discrimination.

Fire breaks out at singer Shaan's residential building, 1 woman injuredTwo separate fires erupted in Mumbai on Monday, injuring an elderly woman in Bandra and destroying warehouses in Kurla Scrap Market. Authorities suspect a short circuit in one case and are probing both incidents.

Amber Heard reacts to Blake Lively's harassment claims against Justin BaldoniAmber Heard recently spoke out against Blake Lively's allegations against Justin Baldoni. Lively filed a lawsuit against Baldoni alleging sexual harassment and running a smear campaign against her.

Justin Baldoni's woman advocacy honour pulled amid Blake Lively's harassment claimsActor Justin Baldoni's award for women's advocacy has been rescinded. This follows the sexual harassment lawsuit and smear campaign allegations levelled against him by his It Ends With Us co-star, Blake Lively.

R Ashwin reveals the thought process behind sudden retirementRavichandran Ashwin reflected on his sudden retirement, emphasising his focus on the game over personal celebration. Are Pakistan primed for Champions Trophy title defence amid dream run? SA vs PAK: After Mohammad Rizwan took charge as their captain, Pakistan have won seven out of nine ODIs. On Sunday, Pakistan beat South Africa in the Johannesburg ODI to win the series 3-0.

Housing board to probe allegations of commercial activity at Dhoni's Ranchi houseThe Jharkhand State Housing Board has taken action against former Indian cricket captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni for reportedly using a residential plot at his Harmu Road residence for commercial activities.

Who is Tanush Kotian? Mumbai off-spinner to be named as R Ashwin's replacementTanush Kotian is set to be added to the Indian squad ahead of the Boxing Day Test. The Mumbai all-rounder is being seen as a replacement for Ravichandran Ashwin, who retired from international cricket.

Dhruv Jurel wins cash prize during Team India's fielding drill before MCG Test Dhruv Jurel's impressive performance in the fielding drill earned him a 300 dollar cash prize, as Team India ramped up preparations for the Boxing Day Test at the MCG. The drill, filled with energy and competition, boosted the team's spirit.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
